title: Negative validation reward when DNS times out
body:
Once in a while my validator is getting negative rewards.

The only thing that shows up in the logs during those dips is

```
 #012at java.base/java.util.TimerThread.run(Timer.java:506)

 #011at java.base/java.util.TimerThread.mainLoop(Timer.java:556)

 #011at org.apache.tuweni.discovery.DNSTimerTask.run(DNSDaemon.kt:89)

 #011at org.apache.tuweni.discovery.DNSResolver.collectAll(DNSResolver.kt:95)

 #011at org.apache.tuweni.discovery.DNSResolver.visitTree(DNSResolver.kt:111)

 #011at org.apache.tuweni.discovery.DNSResolver.visitTree(DNSResolver.kt:120)

 #011at org.apache.tuweni.discovery.DNSResolver.resolveRecord(DNSResolver.kt:73)

 #011at org.apache.tuweni.discovery.DNSResolver.resolveRecordRaw(DNSResolver.kt:155)

 #011at org.xbill.DNS.Resolver.send(Resolver.java:170)

 java.io.IOException: Timed out while trying to resolve all.mainnet.ethdisco.net./TXT, id=32470

 2022-11-15 09:48:34.869+01:00 | Timer-0 | WARN  | DNSResolver | I/O exception contacting remote DNS server when resolving all.mainnet.ethdisco.net

 #011at java.base/java.util.TimerThread.run(Timer.java:506)

 #011at java.base/java.util.TimerThread.mainLoop(Timer.java:556)

 #011at org.apache.tuweni.discovery.DNSTimerTask.run(DNSDaemon.kt:89)

 #011at org.apache.tuweni.discovery.DNSResolver.collectAll(DNSResolver.kt:95)

 #011at org.apache.tuweni.discovery.DNSResolver.visitTree(DNSResolver.kt:111)

 #011at org.apache.tuweni.discovery.DNSResolver.visitTree(DNSResolver.kt:120)

 #011at org.apache.tuweni.discovery.DNSResolver.resolveRecord(DNSResolver.kt:73)

 #011at org.apache.tuweni.discovery.DNSResolver.resolveRecordRaw(DNSResolver.kt:155)

 #011at org.xbill.DNS.Resolver.send(Resolver.java:170)

 java.io.IOException: Timed out while trying to resolve all.mainnet.ethdisco.net./TXT, id=32470

 2022-11-15 09:48:34.869+01:00 | Timer-0 | WARN  | DNSResolver | I/O exception contacting remote DNS server when resolving all.mainnet.ethdisco.net

```

The DNS lookup is supposed to fail as no server is available for the nodes running in that network.
